intro: Atriplex portulacoides var. murex, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its leaves are often covered in a powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The species is part of the Chenopodiaceae family, which includes many salt-tolerant plants.
